body:
It's probably a universal questions for women, whether or not to keep working after saying "I do"s.

A survey by Ucan and iShare sheds a new light on the differences in perception between men and women.

Both genders say no to stay-at-home women.  What's eye-opening is the differences in why.  The majority of men answered they want their wives to keep working after giving births.  The No.1 reason is financial.  The men do not think their salary will be enough to afford a family. 



 未婚、有職者（正社員・契約社員・派遣社員）の男性686名に、自分が働くという前提のもと、未来の妻に出産した後、専業主婦になって欲しいか聞いたところ、55.1％が「できれば働いて欲しい」と回答。「絶対働いて欲しい（7.9％）」を合わせると63.0％が『働いて欲しい』と考えているという結果となった。妻に働いて欲しいと思う理由は「自分だけの収入では経済的に厳しいから（41.9％）」がトップ。2位の「結婚後も家庭だけでなく社会との関わりを持ち続けて欲しいから（25.5％）」に16.4ポイントの差をつけていた。

 When 686 men who are not married and enmployed either full-time or contractor were asked if he would like his future wife to stay at home after giving births with a presumption of him continuing to work, 55.1% of them answered "he would like her to work if possible."  If combined with 7.9% saying "he would absolutely like her to work," the total of 63% resulted in "he wants her to work."  As for the reason why he wants his wife to keep working, 41.9% said "it will be financially difficult with just my salary" and that's at the top.  The second most popular reason is "he wants his wife to continue to have connections with the society outside of home after marriage" with 25.5%, which was 16.4% behind the number one reason. 

On the other hand, women said either they like their jobs or the jobs provides the connection to the society outside of homes.  



 未婚、有職者（正社員・契約社員・派遣社員）の女性568名に結婚し出産した後に専業主婦になりたいかを聞いたところ、「専業主婦にはなりたくない」と回答したのは46.1％だった。
専業主婦になりたくない最も大きな理由は、20代では「仕事が好きでずっと続けていきたいから（28.2％）」、30代では「結婚後も家庭だけでなく社会との関わりを持ち続けたいから（26.9％）」がそれぞれ1位だった。


 When 568 women who are employed, either full-time or contract, and not married were asked whether or not she wants to be a stay-at-home housewife, 46.1% of them answered "no."  The biggest reason why they don't want to be a homemaker among women in their 20's is "I like my job and I want to continue working." (28.2%)  For the women in their 30's, the number one reason was "I want to continue tohave connections with the society outside of home after marriage. (26.9%)


Another interesting part of this survey is that women show high motivation for earning skills during the maternity breaks.  The men also say the women should take advantage of extra free time during the maternity breaks to prepare themselves for reentering the workforce. 



 結婚し出産した後も働き続けるために、「資格取得など今から何か準備をしておく必要があると思う」としたのは65.0％と産休、育休後のキャリアプランを見据えて準備を考えている女性が多いことがわかった。一方、未婚の有職者で、結婚し出産した後に「妻に働いてもらいたい」と考える男性432名にも同じ質問をしたところ、半数以上の51.2％が「準備の必要があると思う」と回答。この質問に「思う」とした男性に、しておいて欲しいと思う準備をひとつ選んでもらったところ、「資格取得など復職に役立つような勉強をして欲しい（45.7％）」が最も多かった。

 In order to keep working after childbirths, 65% said "I believe it is necessary to prepare such as learning new skills" showing many women are already thinking about their careers after reentering the workforce.  On the other hand, when 432 single men with employement who want their future wives to keep working after giving births were asked the same question, the majority, 51.2% answered "she should prepare."  The survey asked those men in the majority what kind of preparation he would like her to do and the most popular answer was "he wants her to study something that would be useful to go back into the workforce" with 45.7%. 

The survey targeted men and women in their 20's and 30's and 2217 men and 1243 women answered.
